captions.text: Hey guys, ChrisFix here
Today I am going to show you how to diagnose a bad fuel injector, using
a screwdriver.
So right here is a fuel injector
and some symptoms of a bad injector are or bad injectors are
bad fuel economy, hesitation
the car idles poorly, engine misfire, and if your engine stalls.
You can also get a lot of engine vibration because a cylinder is misfiring.
and you can also get a check engine light with misfire codes such as
P0301 though P0308
depending on how many cylinders you have.
A bad injector can cause the car to run rich,
or lean
now, these problems can be caused by other things besides bad injectors.
It could be caused by bad spark plugs, bad plug wires, and other problems.
So this video will help you figure out if your injectors are bad
and if so, which ones are bad.
On most cars, fuel injectors are going to be located on top of the engine.
we can see here on my Mazda B3000
there is the fuel rail and it goes into three fuel injectors on this side.
And what we are going to do, we are going to grab our long screwdriver
and put the end of the screwdriver against
the back of the fuel injector, just like that.
And then you put your ear up against this end of the screwdriver
This acts like a doctors stethoscope.
The injectors should be making a constant pulsing (clicking) noise.
So it will sound like a constant clicking
An injector that isn't firing wont make any noise or will make noise inconsistently.
So now I will start the engine and put the camera up against this screwdriver and hopefully you can hear what the injectors sound like.
[Engine Running]
Here is what it should sound like
[Constant Clicking]
You can hear that clicking and it is consistant
That means that the injector is firing and it is firing consistently.
So now you will check each injector
So what is actually happening is that in the injector
there is a coil
which the electricity goes through
and that creates a magnetic field which lifts up the pin
and the pin is attached to a spring
so the charge creates the magnetic field which lifts up the pin,
and then lets go, when there is no charge
and the spring pushes the pin back down
So it is constantly going up and down and letting pulses of gasoline in
and that is how the fuel injector works.
The clicking that you hear is the pin opening and closing.
This test will tell you which injector might not be firing
or might be firing inconsistently
but that is all it will tell you
it wont let you know if there is a bad spray pattern because the injector is dirty
or if the pin isn't going all the way down because the spring is worn out so gasoline is leaking into the cylinder.
So this is just one method you can use, the other test is to test the resistance of the injector using a multimeter.
This is an easy test to do as well, and to see that test,
I have another video, and that video will be up on the screen (click the video)
and the link will be in the description below
Hopefully this video was helpful, if it was, give the video a "thumbs up"
Also consider subscribing.
I publish how to videos weekly and answer all of the questions and comments you guys leave below.
And finally, check out the links to the ChrisFix Facebook and Twitter pages with the links in the description below.

comments.text:
This vid. shows, I'm assuming, a V6 engine like my '05 3.0L Ranger. The 3 
injectors on the pass. side are easy to get to. How do you check the 3 
injectors, that are under the upper intake manifold, on the driver side?﻿
comments.author: fred forbush

comments.text:
+fred forbush That def is good news! The resistance test could tell you if 
you need to replace it or clean it.
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
Good news, I hope. I was able to put my steth. on #4 inject. and heard no 
clicking at all. All the injects. on pass side had definite clicks. I say 
"good news" because you know it is a simple fix compared to what it could 
be.
So, will the resistance test tell me whether I need to replace it or clean 
it?
comments.author: fred forbush

comments.text:
+fred forbush I mean it is worth a shot to test them anyhow. The clicks 
means that the coil in the injector is working but maybe it isnt working 
100% ya know?
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
Ok, I will.
One other question: Is it still necessary to do the resistance test if the 
screwdriver/steth. checks positive for clicks?
comments.author: fred forbush

comments.text: +fred forbush let me know how it goes!
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
Ok, Chris, I'll see if I can at least get to the suspect #4 injector. 
Thanks again.
comments.author: fred forbush

comments.text:
+fred forbush Yes, this is the same exact 3L engine. This process works for 
any engine. When the injectors are hidden, it is hard to do this test. You 
might be able to use a rubber hose like a stethascope and snake it under 
the intake manifold. Otherwise you will need to take the intake off and 
test them this way: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVXchvHefNc

comments.author: Lisa Thomas

comments.text:
+Lisa Thomas Did you check the fuel pressure? What is it: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_oXLUqE4Sf0
It can be the injectors. You can have someone try to start the car and 
listen to see if they are pulsing like in this video. You can also do a 
resistance test on the injectors: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVXchvHefNc
It can also be you are not getting spark so make sure you are getting spark 
from the spark plugs!

have manual  car, when i press accelerator  the RPMs go up and the vehicle

move and max speed is only 50-60. i am not understanding what it could be. 
it will be appericiateable

comments.author: arsh bhullar

comments.text: Thanks for help.. Appreciate +ChrisFix​
comments.author: arsh bhullar

comments.text:
+arsh bhullar Sounds like you need a new clutch and your clutch isnt fully 
engaging (that burning smell is your clutch burning up).
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
There is no engine light. And rpm gose up...but when in put 1st gear it 
takes 15 minutes to pick motion lol. Then when I stop my car I smell like 
some rubber is burning. And when I press clutch i completely release clutch 
and keep pressing race ...then after couple of minutes car start getting 
motion... +ChrisFix​
comments.author: arsh bhullar

comments.text:
Your fuel system is linked to speed but there would be other problems such 
as misfiring if it was your injectors. Do you have any check engine lights? 
The rpms going up is also another indicator that it isnt the injectors. 
This might be a slipping clutch or maybe you are not completely into gear. 
Does your shifter feel solid and firm when you shift? How many miles on the 
clutch?

comments.text: How do you tell if you have a injector leaking down? how would you fix it?﻿
comments.author: Todd Davis

comments.text:
+Todd Davis I mean it could be but it could be many things. Without seeing 
the car it is hard to diagnose it. But that is a good suggestion Todd and 
worth a shot to check out! Thanks!
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text: +ChrisFix could it be a cold start sensor that is bad.
comments.author: Todd Davis

comments.text:
Yes, the fuel pressure test is how you check for leaking injectors. You can 
also see if your engine is running rich by looking at the O2 sensors
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text: Do you have a video on HOW TO CHECK FOR LEAKING INJECTORS.?
comments.author: Todd Davis

comments.text:
Oh you should have told me it was a Vette. When my Vette had hard starting 
problems it was the check valve in the fuel pump. When I put the engine in 
the run position, the pressure would jump up to the correct psi but then 
immediately drop. I would see if you can figure out how to check the O2 
sensor and see if she is running rich. The bank 1 O2 sensor will have a 
high voltage at near .9v if it is running rich. If so, you might have a 
leaking injector. I would also see if when you rev her up, she pops.
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text: The car is a 1989 C-4 Corvette with a 350 tuned Port engine.
comments.author: Todd Davis

comments.text:
The fuel pressure regulator sounds like it is working fine. Was it hard to 
start when you got your 40psi when you turned the key to the run position? 
I am curious if it is hard to start because there isnt enough pressure. Try 
to check the fuel pressure when you cant start it. When you rev the engine 
is there any popping in the exhaust?
comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
This happens only when I start the car up for the first time. I have to 
turn the key over 5-8 times till it cranks. After that it will crank. I did 
put a pressure test gauge on it. When I turn the switch to on the pressure 
went to 40 psi. When I cranked the engine and it started the psi went to 36 
psi in the running mode. When I pulled the vacuum hose of the fuel pressure 
regulator the pressure when to 47 psi. Also when cut the engine off the 
pressure went to 40 psi, I let it set for 15 mins and the pressure went 
39psi. I check it again after 20 mins and the pressure went to 28 psi. Then 
finally it went to 0 psi. So do you think I have a bad fuel pressure 
regulator or a leaking injector?
comments.author: Todd Davis

comments.text:
+Todd Davis To tell if your injectors are leaking you need to do a fuel 
pressure test. A fuel pressure gauge is a great investment and only costs 
$30. Here is the link to how you test the fuel pressure: Fuel Pressure Test
and here is the link to the fuel pressure tester: 
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000R5IASC/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeASIN=B000R5IASC&linkCode=as2&tag=chri0e2-20&linkId=Y4Q624LQRLS2MCKO

comments.author: ChrisFix

comments.text:
Hi Chris! if is okay i would ask about fuel injector seal.I would like to 
know about the reliability of fuel injector seal. How long will it take 
before the seal wear out or broken? Thank you﻿
comments.author: kuro neko

comments.text: I understand now. Thank you for helping me out.
comments.author: kuro neko

comments.text:
+kuro neko It really depends on a lot of things. I have had cars go 300,000 
miles with no problems with injectors or seals and cars go 60,000 and need 
new injectors or o-rings. There is no definitive time line. It is common 
for cars that sit and dont get driven to have dried out injector seals or 
gummed up injectors.
